GameAssets

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameAssets.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class responsible for representing the in-game board. The game board is a 2 dimensional array of [rows][columns], where each position is represented by a boolean: false if position is empty and true if position is filled.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    André Dias (190221068) e Tomás Barroso (190221029)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getSquare

        public boolean[][] getSquare(int indexRow,
                             int indexColumn)
        Custom getter method to return a 3x3 square of the board.
        Parameters:
        indexRow - Initial row position.
        indexColumn - Initial column position.
        Returns:
        3x3 Matrix of the board from the specified indexes.

      • cleanRow

        Cleans a chosen row.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the row.

      • cleanColumn

        Parameters:

      • cleanSquare

        public void cleanSquare(int indexRow,
                        int indexColumn)
        Cleans a chosen 3x3 matrix inside the board. Starting position is top-left.
        Parameters:
        indexRow - Starting position for row.
        indexColumn - Starting position for column.

      • checkRow

        public boolean checkRow(int index)
        Checks if chosen row is filled.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of row.
        Returns:
        Returns the boolean result of the check (true if filled, false if otherwise).

      • checkColumn

        Checks if chosen column is filled.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Returns the boolean result of the check (true if filled, false if otherwise).

        public boolean checkSquare(int indexRow,
                           int indexColumn)
        Checks if chosen 3x3 matrix is filled.
        Parameters:
        indexRow - Starting position for row.
        indexColumn - Starting position for column.
        Returns:
        Returns the boolean result of the check (true if filled, false if otherwise).

      • checkBlockPlacement

        public boolean checkBlockPlacement(Block block,
                                   int locationX,
                                   int locationY)
        Method to check if a given block fits in the given position on the game board.
        Parameters:
        block - Blocks.Block to check.
        locationX - Coordinate x (column).
        locationY - Coordinate y (row).
        Returns:
        Returns the boolean result of the check (true if possible, false if otherwise).
